MS MCQs

    Configure policy templates for custom connectors in Power Automate

    »

    1. A policy template is being applied to a custom connector action that you don’t want it to run for. What should you do to fix the problem?

      Edit the action definition and turn off the policy template.

      Edit the policy template and ensure that the required triggers and actions are explicitly selected and the one that you don’t want to run isn’t selected.

      Edit the policy template and make sure that no triggers and actions are specified.

      Edit the Excluded Actions property of the custom connector and make sure that the target action is selected.


    2. You want to allow makers to configure the host name by providing the URL on the connection dialog box when they instantiate a connection by using your custom connector. What do you need to configure?

      Configure a Route Request policy template.

      Set the User Prompt property of the Set Host URL policy template to Yes.

      You must add a connection property and configure a Set Host URL policy template.

      Configure a Set Property policy template.


    3. The API that you’re using returns categories in a single string field (for example, Categories A,B,C,D). Instead, you want it to be an array. What policy template would you configure?

      Configure a Convert object to an array policy template.

      Configure a Convert delimited string into an array of objects policy template.

      Configure a Convert array to an object policy template.

      Configure a Split string policy template.
